title: Wisconsin Republicans Stand on the Verge of Total, Veto-Proof Power
description: In a 50-50 battleground state, Republicans are close to capturing supermajorities in the State Legislature that would render the Democratic governor irrelevant even if he wins re-election.
dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein
media:credit: Tim Gruber for The New York Times
media:description: John Adams, a Democratic candidate for the State Assembly in northwestern Wisconsin, putting up one of his signs. He and other Democrats in the rural area, long a bright spot for the party, are on the defensive this year.
